alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 2:29PM CDT until July 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Custer, Blaine, Canadian and Caddo Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data and river stage at 1:00 PM CDT was estimated at 13.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 14.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
